title: Studios Said to See Progress in Talks With Striking Actors
description: Following several productive days at the negotiating table, Hollywood studios are growing optimistic that they are getting closer to a deal to end the 108-day actors strike, according to three people briefed on the matter.

title: Mob storms plane arriving in Russia from Tel Aviv, authorities say.
description: A mob stormed an airport in southern Russia where a commercial flight from Tel Aviv had arrived on Sunday night, according to Russian state media and videos posted from the scene. The episode followed several anti-Israel protests in the region that could signal a new point of friction for the Kremlin as it wages a war in Ukraine.

title: A Communal Sigh of Relief: Emerging From Lockdown, Lewiston Gathers to Mourn
description: For the two days after a gunman killed 18 people and injured 13 in Lewiston, Maine, Patrick Hynes and other residents in the area sat in their own homes, under a shelter-in-place order, facing their grief, their rage, in isolation.

title: Eyedrops From Major Brands May Cause Infection, F.D.A. Says
description: Federal health officials are advising consumers to stop using more than two dozen over-the-counter eyedrops products because of a potential risk of eye infection that may lead to partial vision loss or blindness.

title: War Through the Eyes of Gazas Children
description: At a U.N. camp in southern Gaza, children have been forced to flee their homes and live in squalid conditions while trying to make sense of a war with no end in sight.

title: Federal Judge Reinstates Gag Order on Trump in Election Case
description: A federal judge reinstated a gag order on former President Donald J. Trump on Sunday that had been temporarily placed on hold nine days earlier, reimposing restrictions on what Mr. Trump can say about witnesses and prosecutors in the case in which he stands accused of seeking to overturn the 2020 election.

description: A visual guide to the past, present and future of more than 350 New York neighborhoods, as told by more than 37,000 comments from New Yorkers.

description: After winning major gains in wages and benefits from two of the three Detroit automakers, the United Automobile Workers union is looking beyond the Motor City to car companies operating nonunion factories across the South.

title: An Extremely Detailed Map of New York City Neighborhoods
description: More than 37,000 New Yorkers told us where their neighborhoods start and end. We mapped them all.

description: Its an imperfect rule of thumb that musicals lift up and dramas drill down. So what do you call David Adjmis Stereophonic, which does both?

description: Follow live updates on the Israel-Hamas war and Gaza.

title: No Corrections: Oct. 30, 2023
description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

title: Quotation of the Day: Will Frances Strict Cheesemaking Rules Bend for Climate Change?
description: The history of French cheese is a love story between men, animals and the earth.

title: Plans to Slash Emissions at Britains Largest Steel Plant Cause Unease
description: Two hulking towers nearly 300 feet high rise from the steel-making complex that dominates the shoreline of the faded industrial city of Port Talbot in Wales.

description: The Israeli military yesterday signaled a heavier assault on Gaza and warned with increasing urgency that Palestinian civilians should move to the southern part of the Gaza Strip.

description: The word scattershot has appeared in 46 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on July 2 in The Bear and a Chaotic Vision of Work by Melissa Kirsch:

description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Seeking the Right Customers, an Insurer Is Accused of Discrimination
description: When regulators in Maryland said this spring that the small company Erie Insurance had illegally avoided selling policies to people in mostly Black neighborhoods, Erie had a ready answer: It said it was being singled out for simply doing business as usual.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: How Menendez Tried and Failed to Place an Ally in a Key Federal Post
description: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey had a problem  and, prosecutors say, an opportunity. An old friend and political patron was facing federal prosecution. And as New Jerseys senior senator, Mr. Menendez was in a position to help, by recommending the next leader of the office overseeing the case.

title: Biden to Issue First Regulations on Artificial Intelligence Systems
description: President Biden will issue an executive order on Monday outlining the federal governments first regulations on artificial intelligence systems. They include requirements that the most advanced A.I. products be tested to assure that they cannot be used to produce biological or nuclear weapons, with the findings from those tests reported to the federal government.

title: Trumps Children Are Set to Take the Stand at His Fraud Trial This Week
description: Former President Donald J. Trump will testify early next month in a trial that threatens the business empire that is the foundation of his public persona and informed his run for the White House.

title: How a Lucrative Surgery Took Off Online and Disfigured Patients
description: The bulge on the side of Peggy Hudsons belly was the size of a cantaloupe. And it was growing.

title: I Dont Have That Empathy. Its Not in Me Anymore. What Israeli Survivors Believe Now.
description: Survivors of the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks grapple with what can be recovered and what is lost forever.

title: Doctors Wrestle With A.I. in Patient Care, Citing Lax Oversight
description: In medicine, the cautionary tales about the unintended effects of artificial intelligence are already legendary.

title: A Tale of Two Recoveries
description: Good morning. Its Monday. Today well look at a major milestone in the citys recovery from the pandemic  and why theres more to the citys economic outlook.

title: Do Any of These Never Trumpers Have the Power to Persuade?
description: Miles Taylor, a former Department of Homeland Security official in the Trump administration and the author of the new book BLOWBACK: A Warning to Save Democracy From the Next Trump (Atria, 335 pp., $30), made his dramatic entrance in 2018 with an anonymous essay for The New York Times entitled I Am Part of the Resistance Inside the Trump Administration. In it, he heralded the unsung heroes who were working diligently from within to impede Trumps worst inclinations. The following year, having resigned from the D.H.S., Taylor published A Warning, also under the moniker Anonymous. Finally, in 2020, Taylor criticized Trump under his own name, endorsed Joe Biden and identified himself as Anonymous.

title: Southern California Beyond the Freeway
description: Perhaps nothing defines Los Angeles like the freeways: ribbons of asphalt and steel (and traffic jams) tying coast, valley and mountains together in a multilane, limited-access web. These highways were considered so essential that planners nearly jammed one right through the center of swanky Beverly Hills.

title: The Latest Target for California Conservatives? Local School Boards
description: Bill Essayli had no chance of getting one of his first bills through the California State Assembly.

title: Shipping Contributes Heavily to Climate Change. Are Green Ships the Solution?
description: On a bright September day on the harbor in Copenhagen, several hundred people gathered to welcome the official arrival of Laura Maersk.

title: Ive Seen It: Maduro Could Lose Venezuelas Presidential Election
description: Nicols Maduro has been in power for 10 years in Venezuela. In that decade, he has overseen a period of economic collapse, corruption, a sharp increase in poverty, environmental devastation and state repression of dissidents and the press. This has led to an exodus of more than seven million Venezuelans.

title: A Brutal Disease May Soon Be Transformed
description: The sickle cell crises were always different. Sometimes Lynndrick Holmes would wake up with a searing pain in his legs, as though there were knives growing out of his bones. Sometimes it was in his arms, like needles digging into his nerves. Other times it was in his chest. The air felt heavy and every breath burned as though there were a barbed wire cage around his lungs.

title: The Hidden Ghosts of Americas Slave Past
description: I had come to Charleston, S.C., in search of ghosts. So I signed up for one of the many haunted Charleston nighttime walking tours of the Holy City. A few hours later, I wandered through the historic French Quarter, flanked by other tourists searching for a thrill. Gas lights flickered over decaying structures, cobblestone alleys, and houses that were at least a century old.

title: How Music Can Be Mental Health Care
description: The therapy session begins when Isobell, 17, picks up a guitar.

title: Tracing Treasures of Ancient Rome to a Village That Looted Its Own Heritage
description: One towering ancient bronze was found last year in the Sutton Place apartment of a notable New York philanthropist. Another this year in the Metropolitan Museum of Art. A third bronze, the head of a young Roman boy, was seized from Fordham University in March.

title: $3.5 Million Homes in California
description: This house is in the Doas, an area in the Studio City neighborhood populated with midcentury homes. It is close to Laurel Canyon, less than five minutes from Laurel Canyon Dog Park and about 10 minutes from Hollywood. The Fryman Canyon trailhead, popular with hikers and dog walkers because of its views of the Hollywood Hills, is also nearby.

title: I Dont Have That Empathy. Its Not in Me Anymore. What Israeli Survivors Believe Now.
description: After Hamas attacked their country this month, many Israelis fled to hotels, where they sought some version of safety. There, theyve been processing their trauma as they move from that harrowing morning into a new world. In the Opinion video above, filmed in the days after the attack, survivors reflect on what they lost, whom they blame and whats next  for them and for Israel.

title: Why Less Engaged Voters Are Bidens Biggest Problem
description: If youre looking to reconcile the surprisingly strong Democratic showing in the midterm elections with President Bidens weakness in the polls today, consider the political attitudes of two groups of respondents from New York Times/Siena College polls over the last year.

title: In the Early Days of Lockdown, a Writer Considers a Perplexing Age
description: Animals and uncomfortable topics: Count on these in a Sigrid Nunez novel. Her slim, discursive, minor yet charming new one, The Vulnerables, is no exception.

title: Sigrid Nunezs Art of Noticing
description: We began outside on Adirondack chairs still heavy with dew, the 72-year-old American novelist Sigrid Nunez preferring the shade. It was a cloudless morning in mid-August in Middlebury, Vt., and I had gone to meet Nunez, a petite woman of almost suspicious good cheer, to talk about her half-century-long writing career. She had come up from her home in New York City to give a reading  from her new, ninth novel, The Vulnerables, which appears this week  at the Bread Loaf Writers Conference. Through time, Robert Frost, Toni Morrison and George R.R. Martin have all read at Bread Loaf. Nunez was joining those names, an unlikely advent. She didnt publish a novel until she was in her 40s and wasnt able to live on her writing until  47 years after she began  she won the National Book Award, at 67, for The Friend. That novel became an international best seller, translated into more than 30 languages. I wondered how Nunez had managed such persistence.

title: Should School Be a Place to Celebrate Halloween?
description: Halloween is almost here. Will Oct. 31 be a regular day at your school or are there plans for celebrations? Will students and teachers dress up in costume? Will any of your classes have Halloween-themed lesson plans or Monster Mash playing while you work? What about the cafeteria menu  will there be items like spooky spaghetti or black and orange cookies?

title: The Run-Up Returns, Every Week Through Election Day
description: Were just about a year away from Election Day 2024.

title: How Trumps Verbal Slips Could Weaken His Attacks on Bidens Age
description: One of Donald J. Trumps new comedic bits at his rallies features him impersonating the current commander in chief with an over-the-top caricature mocking President Bidens age.

title: The Discourse Is Toxic. Universities Can Help.
description: The conflict in Israel and Palestine has thrown American campuses and society into turmoil.

title: Is the Pantyhose-as-Pants Look a Real Thing?
description: Its true: Pantyhose (one of the most unappealing names for a garment ever invented) have been on the rise for a few seasons now, after disappearing almost entirely from many wardrobes as women not in the British royal family were freed from some of the more egregious dress code strictures of the past century.

title: Driven Out of Pakistan, Afghans Face an Uncertain Future
description: The grandfather always feared this day would come.

title: Both Sides Pay a Bloody Price for Coveted Ukrainian City
description: The tall chimneys of the Avdiivka Coke Plant stand out against the skyline. Beside it a sprawling slag heap juts into the sky, offering a high point overlooking the city of Avdiivka and surrounding villages.

title: Riot Over Plane From Israel Alarms Jews and Draws Condemnation
description: An uprising in southern Russia, where rioters stormed an airport tarmac apparently searching for Jewish passengers on a flight from Israel, has shocked Jews in Russia and beyond, drawn condemnation from the Israeli government and prompted the Kremlin to call an unscheduled meeting to address the clashes.

title: Israels Invasion Begins
description: Over the weekend, the Israeli military appears to have begun an invasion of the Gaza Strip, with tanks rolling into the enclave and Israeli soldiers fighting Hamas inside. But the operation remains shrouded in secrecy, and Israel is revealing little about its actions.

title: When George Santos Called and More: The Week in Reporter Reads
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: Gazas Vital Tunnels
description: There is a transportation network below Gaza, one that Israel is trying to destroy.

title: Middle East War Could Cause Oil Price Shock, World Bank Warns
description: A major escalation of the war between Israel and Hamas  one that spilled over into a broader Middle East conflict  could send oil prices surging as much as 75 percent, the World Bank warned on Monday.

title: Trump Is Still Far Ahead in Iowa Poll, With Haley Matching DeSantis for 2nd
description: Former President Donald J. Trump still has a huge lead in Iowa, according to a poll released Monday, but Nikki Haley has surged to tie Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida for a distant second place.

title: The Global Race to Regulate Artificial Intelligence Is Heating Up
description: President Biden is set to issue an executive order on artificial intelligence on Monday, in his first effort to regulate how U.S. companies develop it and how regulators oversee the technology. The order will create standards for American companies and public agencies.

title: Colorado Trial Considers Whether the 14th Amendment Disqualifies Trump
description: Something the nation has never seen before began playing out in a Denver courtroom Monday morning: a trial to determine whether a major partys likely presidential nominee is eligible to be president at all.

title: Robert Irwin Helped Us See the Light
description: Robert Irwin, who died last week in San Diego, at 95, had one of the most restless, inquiring minds of any artist I have ever known. As the story goes, in 1966 he stepped back from one of his very ethereal, so-called abstract dot paintings  composed of small dots of near-complementary colors  and realized that the visceral, rather than optical phenomenon created by the painting was not the painting itself but rather the real and beautiful shadow cast by the canvas against the wall. He never made another painting. From that point forward he wanted to make works of art without frames, without limits, which he did, continually questioning the very nature of art in almost every visionary work he made.

title: A Vibrant Center in Oakland Has Nurtured Disabled Artists for Nearly 50 Years
description: Its Monday. A vibrant center in Oakland has nurtured disabled artists for nearly 50 years. Plus, how California became Americas contemporary music capital.

title: Your Connections Questions, Answered
description: Our newest game, Connections, is the perfect mix of challenging and fun. During an hourlong Q. and A. in our comments section, Wyna Liu, the editor who creates the game boards, answered your burning questions about the puzzle.

title: London City Ballet Is Revived, Nearly 30 Years After It Shut Down
description: London City Ballet, a company that dissolved almost 30 years ago, is set for a reboot, just as other British performing arts groups are cutting costs and reining in their ambitions.

title: In Europe, Meta Offers Ad-Free Versions of Facebook and Instagram for First Time
description: Meta said on Monday that it will introduce an advertisement-free subscription option for Facebook and Instagram for the first time beginning next month for users in Europe, a sign of how government pressure is leading large tech companies to change their core products.

title: FIFA Bars Former Spanish Soccer Chief for 3 Years
description: Soccers global governing body on Monday barred Luis Rubiales, the former president of Spains soccer federation, from the sport for three years over his forcible kiss of a player after the Womens World Cup final in August.

title: Lempicka, New Musical About Art Deco Artist, to Open on Broadway
description: Lempicka, a new musical about the painter Tamara de Lempicka, will open on Broadway next spring after a decade in development.

title: Tracking Tropical Storm Pilar
description: See the likely path and wind arrival times for Pilar.

title: Autoworkers Score Big Wins in New Contracts With Carmakers
description: A six-week wave of strikes that hobbled the three largest U.S. automakers has resulted in tentative contract agreements that would give workers their biggest pay raises in decades while avoiding a protracted work stoppage that could have damaged the economy.

title: Can You Uncover 15 Horror Titles Lurking Within This Text?
description: Looking for a scary read this Halloween week? The titles of several spine-tingling works are hiding in this puzzle, just waiting for you to discover them.

title: Near an Acapulco Beach: Food, Water and Prayer After Hurricane Otis
description: In a large church displaying a big blue cross near the Acapulco beachfront, dozens of people dozed in sleeping bags along the pews, prayed in silence or anxiously discussed their next move.

title: At New Yorks Friends Museum, Mourning Matthew Perry
description: Every night, Marnie Stein, an elementary school principal from Montreal, falls asleep to the lullaby of Friends streaming on her TV.

title: Blink-182 and the Rolling Stones Bring Rock Back to the Top 10
description: New releases by Blink-182 and the Rolling Stones score high on the Billboard album chart this week, while the music industry waits to see just how gigantic Taylor Swifts latest rerecording will turn out to be.

title: You Wont Find a Richer, Crispier, Creamier, Cheesier Mac and Cheese Recipe
description: With Halloween jumping out at us tomorrow, and Thanksgiving waiting around the corner, the season is sporting its brightest colors. The trees are rubicund with turning leaves; the farmers market ruddy with apples and pumpkins; the impulse rack in the supermarket checkout line ablaze with beckoning bags of candy corn. What better match for this resplendent palette than the melty orange Cheddar bubbling on top of reader favorite Southern macaroni and cheese?

title: The Most Hyped, Most Anticipated, Most Gossiped-About Collection Is Finally Here
description: Almost six years after leaving Celine, the brand she transformed into one of the most influential fashion lines in the world, and a little more than two years after revealing that, wait  she was actually coming back, and under her own name, Phoebe Philo the messiah (sorry, designer) has finally returned to fashion with Phoebe Philo the brand. Can you hear the hosannas? Her first namesake collection is possibly the most hyped, most anticipated, most gossiped-about new line from a formerly beloved name  well, ever.

title: Watching Britney Spears, as a Girl and a Woman
description: There is a moment in Britney Spearss new memoir when she is summoned to an MTV studio and made to review footage of strangers complaining that she was too sexy. Spears, then 18, had just performed at the 2000 Video Music Awards, where she had torn off a sparkly black tuxedo to reveal spangled nude pants and a spangled nude bra, and various pedestrians roving Times Square had decided that she had crossed a line.

title: Energy Dept. Pours Billions Into Power Grids but Warns Its Not Enough
description: The Energy Department on Monday announced $1.3 billion to help build three large power lines across six states, part of a new gusher of money from Washington to upgrade Americas electric grids so they can handle more wind and solar power and better tolerate extreme weather.

title: Desperately Seeking Da Silvano
description: One recent morning, in the bustle of Florences ancient central market, Silvano Marchetto, a stout 76-year-old man with a mane of white hair, sat nursing a Negroni as he considered what he wanted to cook for dinner. The butchers and fishmongers who walked by threw respectful nods his way.

title: Speaker Mike Johnson and the Role of Religion in Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: A Little Momentum for Marijuana
description: Earlier this month, three cousins finally opened ConBud, one of New Yorks first licensed marijuana dispensaries.

title: 16 New Books Coming in November
description: In Austers new novel, an aging philosophy professor struggles to move on after the accidental death of his wife nearly a decade earlier. The book shuttles between present and past, between a solitary life of writing and a passionate, decades-long relationship that continues to haunt him.

title: Window for Meeting Key Climate Goal Is Even Narrower Than Thought
description: Five years and change. Thats how long humans can keep pumping carbon into the atmosphere at our current rate before were likely to push global warming past the most ambitious limit set by the Paris Agreement, according to new estimates released Monday by a team of climate scientists.

title: Review: Chicago, With Nary a Finger Snap
description: The seedy, culturally vibrant and rapidly modernizing Berlin of the 1920s was nicknamed Chicago on the Spree. That moniker sprang to mind recently during the premiere of a masterful and muscular new production of Chicago, directed by Barrie Kosky at the Komische Oper Berlin.

title: Google C.E.O. Says Tech Giant Has Improved the Web for All Consumers
description: As Googles chief executive, Sundar Pichai, tells it, his company has always been on the side of consumers. It has paid billions to other industry giants, like Apple and Samsung, he said, to make sure Googles internet search engine worked as well as it should on those companies devices.

title: At Ballet Theater, a Thrilling Puck and a Moment to Take Stock
description: Mendelssohns music for A Midsummer Nights Dream is full of sweet thunder and other wonderful noises. A cartoon sound effect for jumping isnt among them. Yet when American Ballet Theater performed Frederick Ashtons ballet The Dream last Saturday, every time Jake Roxanders Puck took to the air, I could swear I heard one: boing!

title: Its Me, Isnt It?
description: Hi. Its me. Im the problem, its me.

title: Wanda Poltawska, 101, Who Forged a Friendship With a Future Pope, Dies
description: Wanda Poltawska, a Polish psychiatrist and author who after World War II sought spiritual help to cope with the horrors she had experienced in a Nazi concentration camp and became a lifelong friend of her counselor, a priest who would one day be Pope John Paul II, died on Oct. 24 at her home in Krakow. She was 101.

title: Stream These 10 Movies Before They Leave Netflix in November
description: Family favorites, Oscar-winning (and nominated) acting, bawdy comedies and insightful documentaries are among the highlights of the titles leaving Netflix in the United States in November. (Dates indicate the final day a title is available.)

title: Fly By Jings New Chile Crisp Captures the Flavors of Chengdu
description: Chile crisp or crunch has become as ubiquitous in the kitchen as peanuts on a bar. Depending on whose jar youre opening, there are slight variations. A new one thats densely packed with soybeans, fava beans, yellow split peas and pumpkin seeds doubles down on the crunch factor. The fire component is moderate. Its from Fly By Jing, a source for Sichuan-style condiments made in China and sold online and in stores. Jing Gao, the entrepreneur in charge, said she was inspired by her hometown, Chengdu, for this one.

title: You Cant Hide It: Georgette Heyer and the Perils of Posthumous Revision
description: Georgette Heyer, one of the most popular and influential romance authors of all time, was not a romantic when it came to her work. I ought to be shot for writing such nonsense, she once declared in a letter to her publisher.

title: A Very Slow Game: Why the Pace of Israels Ground Operation Counts
description: In the 23 harrowing days since Hamas attacked Israeli civilians and soldiers, Israels Western allies have had to perform a delicate balancing act: expressing steadfast support for the country during its darkest hours, while navigating the growing public anger on their streets over the intensifying bombardment of Gaza.

title: Prosecutors Turn Sam Bankman-Frieds Own Words Against Him
description: When the cryptocurrency exchange FTX was riding high, Sam Bankman-Fried, the company founder, communicated with the public in a relentless torrent of tweets, TV interviews and pronouncements in front of Congress.

title: Cars Seized by Police Get Supreme Court Scrutiny in Civil Forfeiture Case
description: The Supreme Court seemed torn at an oral argument on Monday about whether to make it easier for people whose cars or other property were seized by the police to argue for their prompt return.

title: Hearing Aids Are More Affordable, and Perhaps More Needed, Than Ever
description: A year ago, the Food and Drug Administration announced new regulations allowing the sale of over-the-counter hearing aids and setting standards for their safety and effectiveness.

title: Keith Giffen, Comic Book Maverick for DC and Marvel, Dies at 70
description: Keith Giffen, a celebrated comic book artist and writer who began his career when comics were still on the fringes of popular culture, in the 1970s, but who rode the superhero wave toward the mainstream with DC Comics Justice League and Marvels Guardians of the Galaxy, popular franchises that became Hollywood films, died on Oct. 9 in Tampa, Fla. He was 70.

title: $23,500 in Coins to Pay a Settlement? Judge Says Keep the Change and Try Again.
description: Pennies, nickels, dimes and quarters might be legal tender but more than 6,500 pounds of loose change is not a proper form of payment, a Colorado judge ruled last week after a defendant attempted to deliver $23,500 in coins to settle a legal dispute.

title: Dust Might Have Snuffed Out the Dinosaurs
description: On a spring day over 66 million years ago, an asteroid slammed into the sea just off the coast of modern-day Mexico. Known as the Chicxulub impact, it set off a global shock wave, earthquakes and megatsunamis that exterminated the nonavian dinosaurs and plunged Earth into a long and dark winter.

title: Autoworkers Strike a Blow for Equality
description: Its not officially over yet, but the United Auto Workers appear to have won a significant victory. The union, which began rolling strikes on Sept. 15, now has tentative agreements with Ford, Stellantis (which I still think of as Chrysler) and, finally, General Motors.

title: F.D.A. Experts Will Vote on Safety of a Cure for Sickle Cell Disease
description: On Tuesday, Oct. 31, an advisory committee to the Food and Drug Administration will consider a gene editing treatment for sickle cell disease, a potentially deadly, excruciatingly painful, lifelong condition in which blood cells are deformed.

title: A Leaning Tower in Italy (Not Pisa) Becomes a Worry
description: The Garisenda Tower in Bologna is not as famous as the Tower of Pisa, but it leans a little more. Lately, though, the dynamic of its movement has become worrisome, and city officials decided recently that the central square where it stands a few meters apart from the much taller Asinelli Tower will be closed off, most likely for years.

title: The Patent Fight That Could Take Apple Watches Off the Market
description: Apple Inc. sells a lot of smart watches during the holidays, but this year its sales of most Apple Watch models may well drop 100 percent  to literally zero  the day after Christmas.

title: Shani Louk, Believed Kidnapped, Was Likely Dead When She Was Taken by Hamas, Family Says
description: Shani Louk, a 23-year-old German-Israeli citizen believed to have been abducted by Hamas militants while attending a music festival on Oct. 7, was most likely killed before she was taken into Gaza, her family said on Monday.

title: X Says It Is Worth $19 Billion, Down From $44 Billion Last Year
description: X, the company formerly known as Twitter, handed out stock grants to employees on Monday that showed it was worth about $19 billion, down about 55 percent from the $44 billion that Elon Musk paid to buy the firm a year ago, according to internal documents seen by The New York Times.

title: Matthew Perry Was One of TVs Best Sparring Partners
description: TV flags are flying at half-staff today, with the news that Matthew Perry died on Saturday. The influence and persistence of Friends is hard to overstate, and Perrys nimble, endearing performance as Chandler Bing is tattooed on the hearts and brains of anyone who watched TV in the 1990s.

title: Ive Been Under Bombardment. There Must Be a Cease-Fire in Gaza.
description: Getting bombed from the sky is a particular horror: The sense that death hangs quite literally over your head, invisible until its too late, and maybe it will hit you. Maybe this moment. Or this. Or this. Every heartbeat hammering through your skull.

title: Reaction to Matthew Perrys Death Shows Enduring Popularity of Friends
description: Friends concluded its 10-season run nearly two decades ago.

title: Matthew Perrys Cause of Death Remains Under Investigation
description: As the authorities continued to investigate the death of the Friends actor Matthew Perry, experts cautioned Monday that it could take weeks or months for the cause to be determined.

title: Under Shroud of Secrecy, Israel Invasion of Gaza Has Begun
description: When Israeli ground forces advanced en masse into the Gaza Strip on Friday evening, just after the Jewish Sabbath began, they did it so secretly that it was hours before the outside world understood what had happened.

title: The Star of Half Baked Harvest Inspires Loyalty  and Controversy
description: Tieghan Gerard was busy lighting pumpkin spice-scented candles when I arrived at her sunlit studio this month. After more than a year of negotiations with the representatives who guard her schedule and her image, shed agreed to cook two recipes Id chosen from the thousands on her immensely popular recipe site, Half Baked Harvest.

title: Biden Issues Executive Order to Create A.I. Safeguards
description: President Biden signed a far-reaching executive order on artificial intelligence on Monday, requiring that companies report to the federal government about the risks that their systems could aid countries or terrorists to make weapons of mass destruction. The order also seeks to lessen the dangers of deep fakes that could swing elections or swindle consumers.

title: Israelis Advance on Gaza City, as Netanyahu Rules Out Cease-Fire
description: Israeli forces on Monday advanced from three directions toward the battered and densely populated Hamas stronghold of Gaza City, slowly pushing deeper into the Gaza Strip while battering the territory with airstrikes and renewing evacuation warnings to people and hospitals.

title: Bidens Support for Israel Now Comes With Words of Caution
description: Three days after Hamas terrorists slaughtered more than 1,400 people, President Biden offered Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu support in the wake of the vow by Israels leader to avenge this black day and to turn Hamas hide-outs into a ruin from the air and on the ground.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Israeli Forces Advance on Gaza City
description: The Israeli military advanced deeper into the Gaza Strip yesterday, approaching Gaza City, the enclaves largest city, from three directions as it battered the territory with airstrikes.

title: KKR Closes Deal to Buy Simon & Schuster
description: The private equity firm KKR completed its acquisition of Simon & Schuster, one of the biggest and most prestigious publishing houses in the United States, on Monday, marking a major shift in the publishing industry.

title: Netanyahu Rejects Calls for a Cease-fire  and for His Resignation.
description: Striking a defiant tone at a rare news briefing on Monday evening, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel ruled out a cease-fire in Gaza, dismissed calls for his resignation and rejected criticism of Israels strikes on civilian homes.

title: Democratic Rifts Over Israel Burst to the Forefront in Congress
description: Israels war against Hamas is exposing deep divisions among Democrats in Congress, as the most outspoken supporters of the Jewish state and vocal pro-Palestinian members on the left trade accusations of bigotry and feud over what role the United States should play in the hostilities.

title: Lionel Messi Wins Eighth Ballon dOr as Soccers Best Player
description: The Ballon dOr, the most prestigious individual soccer award of the year, rewards the best player over a 12-month period. But Lionel Messi essentially won it in just about a month late last year.

title: Frank Howard, Towering Slugger Whose Homers Were, Too, Dies at 87
description: Frank Howard, the Bunyanesque slugger who struck some of baseballs more awesome home runs for the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Washington Senators while rolling up a prodigious strikeout total as well, unable to conquer his penchant for chasing bad balls, died on Monday in Aldie, Va. He was 87.

title: War Closes In on Gaza City
description: After a weekend of debilitating airstrikes and a communications blackout, the Israeli military moved deeper into Gaza, and appeared to be approaching Gaza City from at least three sides.

title: One Would Rather Die With His Family: Some See No Point in Fleeing Gaza.
description: As the Israeli tanks started rolling near Gaza City on Monday, the whispers began to spread  terrifying in their specificity, terrifying in their vagueness.

title: Israeli forces move deeper into Gaza
description: The Israeli military advanced on Gaza City from at least three sides today as it battered the enclave with airstrikes. The deepest reach, about three miles, paralleled the Mediterranean coast toward the Shati refugee camp on the northern flank of the city. Heres a map showing locations of Israeli troops in Gaza.

title: Leah Remini Lists Her Los Angeles Home a Third Time
description: The actress Leah Remini has listed her home in the  picturesque Studio City neighborhood of Los Angeles  and is doing so at a price cut.

title: Prabal Gurung and Jessel Taank Kick Off New Yorks Diwali Season
description: The Pierre hotel on the Upper East Side sparkled on Saturday night as a group of business and entertainment leaders of South Asian descent, joined by friends, kicked off the Diwali season in New York in feathered lehengas, bedazzled saris and gold-stitched sherwanis at the All That Glitters Diwali Ball.

title: Settler Violence Against Palestinians in the West Bank Is Rising
description: Attacks on Palestinians in the occupied West Bank are surging, with at least 115 killed, more than 2,000 injured and nearly 1,000 others forcibly displaced from their homes because of violence and intimidation by Israeli forces and settlers since Hamas attacked Israel on Oct. 7, according the United Nations.

title: Judge Orders Border Agents to Stop Cutting Texas Barbed Wire Fence
description: In the latest chapter in an expanding legal struggle over border security, a federal judge in Texas ordered federal Border Patrol agents on Monday to stop cutting concertina wire that had been placed by the state along the Rio Grande to deter migrants from crossing from Mexico.

title: Teenagers as Critics: A Step-by-Step Guide for Writing a Review
description: So you want to write a review. Whether you are planning on entering our Student Review Contest, writing an assignment for class, or submitting a piece to a school, local or online publication, this guide can help.

title: What 2023 Work of Art or Culture Would You Recommend to Anyone?
description: Taylor Swift, Beyonc, Barbenheimer. This has been a blockbuster year for art and culture. Have you been impressed by what has come out so far?

title: What 2023 Work of Art or Culture Would You Warn Others to Avoid?
description: Is there something you have read, watched, listened to, eaten, visited, played or otherwise experienced this year that you think is so bad that you want to discourage others from experiencing it? If so, what and why?

title: Israels Emergency Medical Service to Receive $88 Million in Gift Led by Michael Bloomberg
description: Michael Bloomberg said on Monday that he would donate nearly $44 million to Magen David Adom, Israels nonprofit emergency medical service, after the Hamas attacks on civilians and soldiers on Oct. 7.

title: A Detailed Satellite View of Israels Invasion
description: Hundreds of armored vehicles have pushed miles past the border into urban areas on the outskirts of Gaza City, satellite imagery shows.

title: Utterly Devastated: Friends Cast Reacts to Matthew Perrys Death
description: Matthew Perrys fellow Friends cast members expressed their grief and sadness about his death in a joint statement to People magazine on Monday.

title: Union Victories May Lift Biden, as U.A.W. Targets Tesla and Others
description: The United Automobile Workers big wins with Detroits Big Three automakers could also prove to be a significant political victory for President Biden, who openly sided with striking workers to pressure the companies, General Motors, Ford and Stellantis, to produce generous concessions.

title: What to Know About the Automakers Deals With the U.A.W.
description: The United Automobile Workers union reached a tentative agreement with General Motors on Monday, following similar deals in recent days with Ford Motor and Stellantis, the parent company of Ram, Chrysler and Jeep.

title: Top Marine General Hospitalized After Apparently Having Heart Attack
description: Gen. Eric M. Smith, the Marine Corpss commandant and top officer, was hospitalized on Sunday evening after an unspecified medical emergency, the service said on Monday.

title: Louis Oliver Gropp Dies at 88; Led Shelter Magazines Through Turmoil
description: Louis Oliver Gropp, a steady shepherd of shelter magazines through decades of turmoil as editor in chief of House & Garden, Elle Dcor and House Beautiful, died on Oct. 17 at his home in Greenport, N.Y., on Long Island. He was 88.

title: Israeli Soldier Rescued After Hamas Abduction
description: The Israeli military said on Monday that it had rescued an Israeli soldier who was abducted from an Israeli army base on Oct. 7 and taken to Gaza during the Hamas-led terrorist attacks in Israel.

title: Police Were Told Maine Gunman Had Threatened to Carry Out Shooting Spree
description: The Army Reserve and a Maine sheriffs department were aware of a reservists deteriorating mental health more than five months before he killed 18 people in Lewiston, Maine, according to records released on Monday. Just six weeks ago, the records show, he had grown increasingly paranoid, punched a friend and said he was going to carry out a shooting spree.

title: Could Matthew Perrys Chandler-Speak Be Any More Memorable?
description: Matthew Perry, the actor who died on Saturday at 54, had a distinctive linguistic style that he lobbed deep into the national consciousness. His Chandler Bing on Friends was too clever and cool for traditional TV catchphrases: Try to imagine him saying Bazinga! or even his roommate Joeys How you doin. Instead it was how Perry spoke, with an infectious inflection, that pushed his musical Chandler-speak into the American vernacular.

title: Famed Iranian Rights Lawyer Reportedly Jailed and Beaten
description: A prominent Iranian human rights lawyer, Nasrin Sotoudeh, was arrested and severely beaten, her husband said on Monday  one of several activists taken into custody at the funeral in Tehran of a girl who was fatally injured after a reported confrontation with the enforcers of Irans strict dress code for women.

title: Hochul Visits Cornell to Reassure Jewish Students Rattled by Online Threats
description: In the wake of online posts threatening violence against Jewish students and institutions at Cornell University, Gov. Kathy Hochul on Monday visited the campus in Ithaca, N.Y., to condemn the posts as hate speech and lay out the steps her administration is taking to help keep students safe.

title: Buffy Sainte-Maries Indigenous Parentage Is Questioned
description: The parentage of Buffy Sainte-Marie, a folk singer known for her activism on behalf of Indigenous people, was questioned after CBC News reported that it had found a birth certificate indicating that she was born to white parents in Massachusetts, and not on a Piapot Cree reservation in Canada.

title: Why Oslo Still Has Relevance
description: A few days after Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin was assassinated on Nov. 4, 1995, I remember an Israeli acquaintance telling me that however terrible the circumstances of his death, it had established Mr. Rabin as a martyr for peace. As a result, the Oslo peace process he had begun, named after the city where it was secretly hatched, had become irreversible.

title: What to Know About Robert De Niros Trial Over a Workplace Dispute
description: A four-year legal battle between the actor Robert De Niro and a former employee went to trial on Monday in federal court in Manhattan, where competing claims of gender discrimination and improper spending were aired in open court.

title: Fruit Pure Pouches May Contain Lead, F.D.A. Warns Parents
description: Federal health officials are warning parents and caregivers not to buy WanaBana apple cinnamon fruit pure pouches or feed them to their children because the product may contain elevated levels of lead.

title: I Can Get It for You Wholesale Review: Rag Trade Revival, Recut for Today
description: What a shame that the 1962 musical I Can Get It for You Wholesale, a critique of vulture capitalism disguised as a rag trade comedy, is now best known as the Broadway show that gave Barbra Streisand her start at 19. No matter how good she was  and the recording of her big number, Miss Marmelstein, overflows with stupendous, youthful invention  hers was only a small, comic role in a much darker story by the novelist Jerome Weidman; her song a bauble in a fascinating and multifaceted score by Harold Rome.

title: Man Indicted Over Threats to D.A. and Sheriff in Trumps Georgia Case
description: A man who threatened a prosecutor and a sheriff involved in the Georgia investigation of former President Donald J. Trump for election interference was indicted in federal court on Monday, the U.S. Attorneys Office said.

title: Warning Signs
description: Jump to: Todays Theme | Tricky Clues

title: Flashback TV Quiz: The One About Chandler
description: Can you place 8 of these memorable Friends moments in order?

title: In Global Race to Offer Green Subsidies, U.K. Prefers Slow and Steady
description: The question of how Britain will respond to President Bidens Inflation Reduction Act, the $369 billion landmark legislation offering deep subsidies for green investment, has followed Jeremy Hunt, Britains finance minister, for most of the past year.

title: Now Showing, an Ancient Spell Book for the Dead
description: In the mid-19th century, a British antiquarian named Sir Thomas Phillipps announced his intention of owning one copy of every book in the world. A professed vello-maniac, Mr. Phillipps, a quarrelsome baronet, bought manuscripts indiscriminately from booksellers with whom he engaged in ceaseless battle. Soon there was hardly room in his moldering Cotswolds mansion for his second wife, Elizabeth, who eventually moved to a boardinghouse in Torquay, an English working-class seaside resort. By the time Mr. Phillipps died in 1872, he had amassed an unparalleled collection of 60,000 documents and 50,000 printed books.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: The Israeli military advanced deeper into Gaza yesterday, approaching Gaza City from three directions. Israel has provided only limited details about the invasion, but photos and videos verified by The New York Times, as well as satellite imagery, showed troops and armored vehicles closing in on the city, Gazas largest, from the north, east and south. Israel has also continued to batter the territory with airstrikes.

title: 6 Great Space Images in October
description: An eclipse's shadow from space, India's astronaut capsule and a confused space telescope.

title: Japan Takes Another Step Away From Easy Money
description: The people who work the levers of Japans economy are in a bind: The countrys low-interest rates, which they have long used to goose growth, are now well out of step with other big economies. Bridging that gap is tricky.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Candy That Grew From Kernel to Icon
description: It is the ultimate survival sugar rush. Candy corn dont go bad. Itll last forever.

title: Corrections: Oct. 31, 2023
description: An article on Monday about the 25th anniversary of the album The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill misstated one of the guests onstage with the Fugees at the Prudential Center. Rah Digga joined the group, not Remy Ma.

title: Aaron Spears, Drummer for Usher and Other Stars, Dies at 47
description: Aaron Spears, a Grammy-nominated drummer who played with Usher, Ariana Grande and many other major pop stars, has died. He was 47.

title: Word of the Day: plaintive
description: The word plaintive has appeared in 51 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on July 29 in Sinead OConnor, Prince and the Thrill of Nothing Compares 2 U by Christopher Kuo:

title: Late Night Bids Adieu to Mike Pences Presidential Bid
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Todays Wordle Review
description: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for todays puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.

title: The Connections Companion
description: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to todays Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle  and emotional  support.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Scary Movies
description: What was your first, true afraid-to-do-anything-alone-afterward scary movie?

title: How Posters of Kidnapped Israelis Ignited a Firestorm on American Sidewalks
description: KIDNAPPED, the posters say, in big block letters above pictures of people taken hostage by Hamas terrorists during the Oct. 7 attack in Israel, urgent reminders of the men, women and children still being held hostage in Gaza.

title: Rancorous Primary Fight Brews Over Democrats Stance on Israel
description: Representative Jamaal Bowman was already facing blowback from Jewish leaders in his district and a growing primary threat for bucking his partys stance on Israel.

title: The Apple-Picking Apocalypse of Upstate New York
description: It was a beautiful Friday afternoon in the Hudson Valley, 70 degrees in October and not a cloud in the sky: perfect weather for apple picking.

title: For One Writer, Crime Is a Window Into Society
description: A murder in a Northern California coastal town. The unsolved case of a girl who disappeared near Reykjavik, Iceland, in 1956. A spray-painted message near a body, warning: MIND YOUR BUSINESS.

title: King Charles, Visiting Kenya, Faces Calls to Answer for Colonial Abuses
description: At 86, his gnarled hands grasping a walking stick as he ambled around his small patch of land facing Mount Kenya, Joseph Macharia Mwangi recalled with bitterness the years that he had spent fighting the British colonial government in Kenya.

title: New Zealand Volcano Owner Is Found Guilty of Safety Failure
description: Nearly four years after 22 people were killed by a volcanic eruption on White Island in New Zealand, a court ruled that the company that owns the island was guilty of violating a safety law.

title: After 8-Hour Standoff Near Tokyo, Hostages Are Free and Suspect Is Held
description: The police in Japan arrested a suspect on Tuesday night after an armed man holed up in a post office in a Tokyo suburb and took two hostages, prompting a nearly eight-hour standoff that was an unsettling episode for a country where gun violence is extremely rare.

title: Caster Semenya: Im Still a Woman
description: In 2009, the 18-year-old South African track star Caster Semenya arrived in Berlin to run in the 800-meter event in that years World Championships. But before she was allowed to participate in the race  which she won  the International Association of Athletics Federations subjected her to multiple rounds of nonconsensual gender confirmation tests in response to public speculation that she was unfairly competing in the womens category because of rumors she was male. A panel of German doctors tried to perform a transvaginal ultrasound on her, with only an English-German translator present (English is Semenyas second language). She refused.

title: The Man Who Was Always Hungry
description: You cant trust poets. They feel too keenly for other people, are too ready to climb into the hearts and guts of things and lay them bare and bloody and obscenely beautiful in front of you. Even monsters. Maybe especially monsters.

title: This Florida School District Banned Cellphones. Heres What Happened.
description: One afternoon last month, hundreds of students at Timber Creek High School in Orlando poured into the campuss sprawling central courtyard to hang out and eat lunch. For members of an extremely online generation, their activities were decidedly analog.

title: The Cost of Being Disabled in New York City Housing
description: As a wheelchair user, I have always had to pay a premium to live in an apartment independently. In my nine years living in New York City, I have spent more than $18,500 on automatic door openers, amenities just to make the places Ive lived in accessible.

title: Why It Was Worth $49,000 to Become Brooklyn Org
description: Good morning. Its Tuesday. Whats in a name? Well find out about a Brooklyn nonprofit that rebranded itself after buying a model URL. Well also meet the cousins behind one of the states first licensed marijuana dispensaries.

title: Ready to Retire? Consider Your Family First.
description: After touring several retirement communities, Marta Genoni winnowed the field to two appealing possibilities not far from the home she shared with her husband, Kenneth, a lawyer, in Westfield, N.J. But unable to make a final decision she asked her elder daughter, a college administrator in Richmond, Va., to come north and weigh in.

title: I Was Trying to Build My Sons Resilience, Not Scar Him for Life
description: When my wife and I took our 7-year-old son to climb a 900-hundred-foot piece of rock near our home in Colorado, it seemed like a good idea at the time.

title: The Big Cheese (Tour)
description: On a sunny October afternoon in the London neighborhood of Bermondsey, a cool breeze surprised me with the winy smell of apples. It brought on a sudden sharp craving for a nice chunk of Cheddar, the fruit and the cheese together being a favorite after-school snack when I was growing up in Connecticut. This was an appropriate prompt, too, since I was on my way to a very privileged lesson in British farmhouse cheeses at the beginning of an eight-day, cheese-themed trip to London and Somerset run by the specialty tour company Cheese Journeys.

title: Should I Be Taking Supplements?
description: Q: Are any supplements proven to be helpful for health?

title: Why Cant We Give Up the Ghosting?
description: Horror movies are always a good reflection of the culture that created them. In the 1980s, as if in response to the repressive evangelical movement gaining hold in American politics, grotesque body horror (The Fly, Society) became a defining genre, along with a succession of gratuitously violent slasher films in which hormonal teenagers meet gruesome ends, usually just beyond the sphere of adult supervision (The Burning, Friday the 13th, Sleepaway Camp). In the 1990s, horror films grew more excessive, with bigger budgets, but some added irony and self-awareness to speak to a generation of jaded young viewers who had seen it all: The potential victims in Wes Cravens Scream (1996) display a deep knowledge of horror film tropes.

title: The Busy Doctor Who Gave Himself Another Job: Tracking Nazi Loot
description: His day began at 6 a.m. with a call to Amsterdam from his office in Vancouver. An hour later he gave an online lecture to a class in Ireland, immediately followed by a call with a scientist in Boston about research.

title: In Chicago, a Neighborhood of Immigrants Is Conflicted About More Arrivals
description: For generations, Chicagos Brighton Park neighborhood has been made and remade by successive waves of immigrants.

title: A Meteoric Career, Cut Short, Still Burns Bright
description: A heavy irony hangs over Michael Richardss work: The artist known for images of pilots, airplanes, wings and targets died, age 38, in the Sept. 11 attacks. He had spent the night in his studio on the 92nd floor of the World Trade Centers north tower.

title: Why Modern Micromanagement of Kids Is Spooky
description: The Halloween season means one thing for todays parents: work. Theres costumes, theres decorations and, if you follow parenting trends, theres now convincing your kids to hand over their candy to the switch witch.

title: School Cellphone Bans Are Trending. Do They Work?
description: Earlier this year, Florida passed a law requiring public schools statewide to ban student cellphone use during class time. The new state rules reflect an intensifying global crackdown on young people and social media.

title: The Joy of Picking Up Other Peoples Trash
description: Ive become a real kvetch. I have lived in the same neighborhood, in Brooklyn, for the better part of the past decade, spending the last five years in a hand-me-down apartment from a friend. One day I recognized where I lived; the next, I didnt. Overnight, gaggles of 20-somethings began to roam the streets, presumably in search of eyebrows, which none of them seemed to have. Rent became obscene. Id find myself the only Black person standing on the corner, waiting for the light to change. New high-rises as elegant as Lego blocks appeared on what seemed like every other street. Passive-aggressive notes from new residents started popping up in my lobby. One night, I came home to a can of alcoholic seltzer on top of my mailbox.

title: On This Issue, the House G.O.P. Whack Jobs Have a Point
description: Just days before winning the race for speaker of the House last week, Representative Mike Johnson of Louisiana sent a letter to colleagues laying out a plan to complete the budget process by bringing 12 individual appropriations bills to the floor. Mr. Johnson billed his plan as a way to allow us to demonstrate good governance.

title: If Not This, Then What Should Israel Do?
description: Two things are true: Israel must do something, and what its doing now is indefensible. So writes Zack Beauchamp, a senior correspondent at Vox.

title: They Bought a House Together (and Havent Lived to Regret It)
description: For two art enthusiasts who pooled their resources to buy a country house outside New York City, the idea seemed brilliant: Why wouldnt we do this?

title: American Muslims Are in a Painful, Familiar Place
description: When President Biden landed in Tel Aviv days after Hamass Oct. 7 massacre of more than 1,400 people, he told an audience of Israelis that this was not just Israels Sept. 11, that it was like 15 9/11s.

title: Past Lies About War in the Middle East are Getting in the Way of the Truth Today
description: Moshe Lavi, whose relatives have been taken hostage by Hamas, recently talked to a group of New York Times journalists about his familys agony.

title: Is Buying Real Estate With a Friend Really a Good Idea?
description: In the early days of the pandemic, Jonathan Travis and his friend Ethan Rafii were visiting another friends country house outside New York City when they began to dream big. What if they pooled their resources and bought a shared house together?

title: The Supreme Courts Social Media Cases Can Strengthen Our Democracy
description: Americans spend a lot of time on social media, and this term the Supreme Court will do the same. Over the next few months  beginning Tuesday  the court will hear a series of cases requiring it to resolve First Amendment questions arising out of the role that major social media platforms play in hosting, shaping and setting the limits of public discourse online.

title: What to Watch for as the Federal Reserve Meets This Week
description: Federal Reserve officials are widely expected to leave interest rates steady at the conclusion of their two-day meeting on Wednesday. But investors and economists will watch for any hint about whether rates are likely to stay that way  or whether central bankers still think they might need to increase them again in the coming months.

title: Hezbollah Hesitates as Israel Strikes Gaza
description: As Israeli troops move deeper south into Gaza with the goal of destroying Hamas, the world is closely watching what happens on Israels northern border, where its forces have engaged for weeks in intense clashes with another, more powerful foe, Hezbollah.

title: Bariatric Surgery at 16
description: Last fall, Alexandra Duarte, who is now 16, went to see her endocrinologist at Texas Childrens Hospital, outside Houston. From age 10, she had been living with polycystic ovary syndrome and, more recently, prediabetes. After Alexandra described her recent quinceaera, the doctor brought up an operation that might benefit her, one that might help her lose weight and, as a result, improve these obesity-related problems.

title: With Executive Order, White House Tries to Balance A.I.s Potential and Peril
description: How do you regulate something that has the potential to both help and harm people, that touches every sector of the economy and that is changing so quickly even the experts cant keep up?

title: U.S. Looks to Allay European Fears of a Subsidy War
description: The Biden administration is trying to ease European concerns about Americas new climate and tax law, which some allies view as a protectionist industrial policy that threatens their economies.

title: Americas Rifle Fetish Is Destroying Its Sense of Freedom
description: In Anthony Manns 1950 western Winchester 73, a rare and much-desired Winchester rifle brings misery and death to the unlucky souls who manage to bring it into their possession. In the West as brought to you by Mann  and his star, a troubled and morally ambiguous Jimmy Stewart  the gun isnt a symbol of freedom as much as it is a curse, destined to ruin everyone who covets its power.

title: Matthew Perry and the Loneliness of Addiction
description: A long time ago I lay awake for hours, terrified that they would be my last ones on earth. I had committed myself to quitting cocaine, which was my second addiction, the first being years of amphetamines. I was devoting myself to cleaning up and getting healthy. But then a friend called who I had routinely done coke with and who always had a supply of the drug. Earlier on that black night, Id careened backward into the familiar land of white lines on a mirror and a heart racing way too fast. It was pounding so hard, so fast, so loud, I was certain it and I couldnt survive.

title: In Cyberattacks, Iran Shows Signs of Improved Hacking Capabilities
description: Iranian hackers are waging a sophisticated espionage campaign targeting the countrys rivals across the Middle East and attacking key defense and intelligence agencies, according to a leading Israeli-American cybersecurity company, a sign of how Irans quickly improving cyberattacks have become a new, important prong in a shadow war.

title: What Is the Scariest Song of All Time? Poem? YouTube Video?
description: For Halloween, we asked writers and editors around The New York Times for the pieces of art or culture that they turn to when they need a good scare. The result is a collection of audio stories that will send a chill down your spine, make your hair stand on end and keep you entertained.

title: A Historic Strike (and Win) for Autoworkers
description: A wave of strikes that has paralyzed the auto industry came to an end on Monday, when the last of the three big car manufacturers, General Motors, reached a deal with the United Automobile Workers union.

title: Saudi Arabia Is Set to Be Sole Bidder for 2034 World Cup
description: Saudi Arabia emerged as the likely winner in the abbreviated race to host soccers World Cup in 2034 on Tuesday after Australias soccer federation announced that it would not bid for the tournament. The decision most likely removed the only hurdle in the way of Saudi Arabias plan to bring the worlds most-watched sporting event back to the Gulf.

title: The Autoworkers Victories
description: If you want to understand why the United Auto Workers union has evidently won its strikes against Detroits Big Three, it helps to return to the work of a 20th-century economist named Richard Lester.

title: Bankman-Frieds Risky Defense Strategy Faces Another Big Test
description: Sam Bankman-Fried is to return to the stand today after the former wunderkind faced a four-hour grilling that exposed inconsistencies in his assertion that he didnt defraud customers of FTX, his bankrupt crypto exchange.

title: Raging Fire in California Forces Thousands From Their Homes
description: A fast-moving fire in the small town of Aguanga in Southern California forced the evacuation of thousands of people and had burned more than 1,200 acres as of Tuesday morning, according to the Riverside County Fire Department.

title: Eurozone Economy Shrinks, While Price Pressures Ease
description: Growth in the eurozone contracted unexpectedly this summer, as  rising interest rates cooled momentum in Germany and France, the regions two biggest economies, Europes statistics agency reported Tuesday.

title: A Key Measure of Wages Grew at a Moderate Pace This Summer
description: A measure of pay and benefits that officials at the Federal Reserve have been watching closely as they try to gauge the heat of the labor market grew at a moderate pace over the summer.

title: Does Salvation for Californias Redwoods Lie Out of State?
description: California has some impressive distinctions when it comes to trees: The state is home to the largest, tallest and oldest trees in the world.

title: The First of Our Friends to Go
description: If youre fortunate to live long enough, eventually you get The Call. Sometimes its an actual call, sometimes a social media post or a conversation on the street. But the message is the same: A friend of your youth has died.

title: Why Doug Burgum Is Staying in a Race He Can Afford to Lose
description: Gov. Doug Burgum of North Dakota knows that many people, including powerful voices in his own party, think he should quit the Republican presidential primary, abandoning his quixotic bid so that momentum can gather behind a challenger to Donald J. Trump, and ultimately President Biden.

title: News Group Says A.I. Chatbots Heavily Rely on News Content
description: News publishers have argued for the past year that A.I. chatbots like ChatGPT rely on copyrighted articles to power the technology. Now the publishers say developers of these tools disproportionately use news content.

title: Biden Administration Approves Biggest Offshore Wind Farm Yet, in Virginia
description: The Interior Department on Tuesday approved a plan to install up to 176 giant wind turbines off the coast of Virginia, clearing the way for what would be the nations largest offshore wind farm yet.

title: Where Israelis, Palestinians and Iranians Must Listen to One Another
description: The young musicians, in jeans and fuzzy sweaters, had just finished rehearsing a Prokofiev symphony in an empty concert hall. Then they put away their instruments and settled back into their orchestra chairs to talk about the war.

title: Weekly Student News Quiz: Gaza Strip, Matthew Perry, World Series
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: A Footpath in England, Torn Down, Keeps Being Rebuilt by Fairies
description: A small, beloved footbridge in the county of Norfolk has been dismantled twice only to be replaced by local fairies, according to village lore, in a long-running dispute between a coastal English village and the National Trust, a conservation charity.

title: Three Great Documentaries to Stream
description: The proliferation of documentaries on streaming services makes it difficult to choose what to watch. Each month, well choose three nonfiction films  classics, overlooked recent docs and more  that will reward your time.

title: Lets Make Some Meatballs
description: Everyone has comfort food. Heres mine: juicy meatballs done Italian American style, served with homemade tomato sauce or piled on top of a spaghetti heap.

title: Russia Detains Two Soldiers Suspected of Killing 9 Civilians
description: Two Russian soldiers have been detained in connection with the killing of nine people, including two children, in Ukrainian territory controlled by Moscow, Russian authorities said, in a rare admission that occupying forces may have committed a crime against Ukrainian civilians.

title: After Mass Shooting in Maine, No Clarity on Whether Gun Laws Will Change
description: On Sunday, Arthur Barnard will bury his oldest child, Artie Strout, 42, who was one of the 18 people killed in the countrys deadliest mass shooting so far this year.

title: Israels U.N. Ambassador Criticized for Wearing a Yellow Star of David
description: The head of Israels Holocaust memorial on Tuesday criticized the countrys ambassador to the United Nations for wearing a yellow Star of David patch during an address to the Security Council, saying the symbol, which was used under the Nazis to identify Jews, dishonors both the country and victims of the Holocaust.
